normalize method

tag.name: param
tag.description: A path string

tag.name: return
tag.description: The canonical path

docblock.description: Returns the directory part of the path.
docblock.long-description:
This method is similar to PHP's dirname(), but handles various cases where dirname() returns a weird result:
- dirname() does not accept backslashes on UNIX - dirname("C:/webmozart") returns "C:", not "C:/" - dirname("C:/") returns ".", not "C:/" - dirname("C:") returns ".", not "C:/" - dirname("webmozart") returns ".", not "" - dirname() does not canonicalize the result
This method fixes these shortcomings and behaves like dirname() otherwise.
The result is a canonical path.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A path string

tag.name: return
tag.description: The canonical directory part. Returns the root directory if the root directory is passed. Returns an empty string if a relative path is passed that contains no slashes. Returns an empty string if an empty string is passed

docblock.description: Returns the root directory of a path.
docblock.long-description: The result is a canonical path.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A path string

tag.name: return
tag.description: The canonical root directory. Returns an empty string if the given path is relative or empty

docblock.description: Returns the filename from a file path.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The path string

docblock.description: Returns the filename without the extension from a file path.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The path string

tag.name: param
tag.description: If specified, only that extension is cut off (may contain leading dot)

tag.name: return
tag.description: Filename without extension

docblock.description: Returns the extension from a file path.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The path string

tag.name: param
tag.description: Forces the extension to be lower-case (Requires mbstring extension for correct multi-byte character handling in extension)

tag.name: return
tag.description: Extension from a file path (without leading dot)

docblock.description: Returns whether the path has an extension.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The path string

tag.name: param
tag.description: If null or not provided, checks if an extension exists, otherwise checks for the specified extension or array of extensions (with or without leading dot)

tag.name: param
tag.description: Whether to ignore case-sensitivity (Requires mbstring extension for correct multi-byte character handling in extension)

tag.name: return
tag.description: true if the path has an (or the specified) extension, otherwise false

docblock.description: Changes the extension of a path string.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The path string with filename.ext to change

tag.name: param
tag.description: New extension (with or without leading dot)

tag.name: return
tag.description: The path string with new file extension

docblock.description: Returns whether a path is absolute.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A path string

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns true if the path is absolute, false if it is relative or empty

docblock.description: Returns whether a path is relative.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A path string

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns true if the path is relative or empty, false if it is absolute

docblock.description: Turns a relative path into an absolute path.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A path to make absolute

tag.name: param
tag.description: An absolute base path

tag.name: return
tag.description: An absolute path in canonical form

tag.name: throws
tag.description: If the base path is not absolute or if the given path is an absolute path with a different root than the base path

docblock.description: Turns a path into a relative path.

tag.description: A path to make relative

tag.name: param
tag.description: An base path

tag.name: return
tag.description: A relative path in canonical form

tag.name: throws

docblock.description: Returns whether the given path is on the local filesystem.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A path string

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns true if the path is local, false for a URL

docblock.description: Returns the longest common base path of a set of paths.

tag.name: param
tag.description: A list of paths.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The longest common base path in canonical form or `null` if the paths are on different Windows partitions.

docblock.description: Returns whether a path is a base path of another path.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The base path to test.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The other path.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Whether the base path is a base path of the other path.

docblock.description: Splits a part into its root directory and the remainder.
docblock.long-description:
If the path has no root directory, an empty root directory will be returned.
If the root directory is a Windows style partition, the resulting root will always contain a trailing slash.
list ($root, $path) = Path::split("C:/webmozart") // => array("C:/", "webmozart")
list ($root, $path) = Path::split("C:") // => array("C:/", "")

tag.name: param
tag.description: The canonical path to split

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array with the root directory and the remaining relative path

docblock.description: Converts string to lower-case (multi-byte safe if mbstring is installed).

tag.name: param
tag.description: The string

tag.name: return
tag.description: Lower case string

docblock.description: Very simple 'template' parser. Replaces (for example) {name} with the value of $vars['name'] in strings

docblock.description: Returns a lowercase and trimmed string separated by dashes. Dashes are inserted before uppercase characters (with the exception of the first character of the string), and in place of spaces as well as underscores.

tag.description: Returns a string with smart quotes, ellipsis characters, and dashes from Windows-1252 (commonly used in Word documents) replaced by their ASCII equivalents.

docblock.description: Trims the string and replaces consecutive whitespace characters with a single space. This includes tabs and newline characters, as well as multibyte whitespace such as the thin space and ideographic space.

tag.name: method
tag.description: Trims the string and replaces consecutive whitespace characters with a single space. This includes tabs and newline characters, as well as multibyte whitespace such as the thin space and ideographic space.

docblock.description: Returns an ASCII version of the string. A set of non-ASCII characters are replaced with their closest ASCII counterparts, and the rest are removed unless instructed otherwise.

tag.description: Returns an ASCII version of the string. A set of non-ASCII characters are replaced with their closest ASCII counterparts, and the rest are removed unless instructed otherwise.

docblock.description: Returns the replacements for the toAscii() method.

tag.description: Returns the replacements for the toAscii() method.

docblock.description: Pads the string to a given length with $padStr. If length is less than or equal to the length of the string, no padding takes places. The default string used for padding is a space, and the default type (one of 'left', 'right', 'both') is 'right'. Throws an InvalidArgumentException if $padType isn't one of those 3 values.

tag.name: method
tag.description: Pads the string to a given length with $padStr. If length is less than or equal to the length of the string, no padding takes places. The default string used for padding is a space, and the default type (one of 'left', 'right', 'both') is 'right'. Throws an InvalidArgumentException if $padType isn't one of those 3 values.

docblock.description: Returns a new string of a given length such that the beginning of the string is padded. Alias for pad() with a $padType of 'left'.

tag.name: method
tag.description: Returns a new string of a given length such that the beginning of the string is padded. Alias for pad() with a $padType of 'left'.

docblock.description: Returns a new string of a given length such that the end of the string is padded. Alias for pad() with a $padType of 'right'.

tag.name: method
tag.description: Returns a new string of a given length such that the end of the string is padded. Alias for pad() with a $padType of 'right'.

docblock.description: Returns a new string of a given length such that both sides of the string are padded. Alias for pad() with a $padType of 'both'.

tag.name: method
tag.description: Returns a new string of a given length such that both sides of the string are padded. Alias for pad() with a $padType of 'both'.

docblock.description: Converts the string into an URL slug. This includes replacing non-ASCII characters with their closest ASCII equivalents, removing remaining non-ASCII and non-alphanumeric characters, and replacing whitespace with $replacement. The replacement defaults to a single dash, and the string is also converted to lowercase.

tag.name: method
tag.description: Converts the string into an URL slug. This includes replacing non-ASCII characters with their closest ASCII equivalents, removing remaining non-ASCII and non-alphanumeric characters, and replacing whitespace with $replacement. The replacement defaults to a single dash, and the string is also converted to lowercase.
